Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.name: sendMessage(_:)
Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.abstract: sendMessage asynchronously sends a given message and returns the response data. This function may throw an error if the message is invalid or the send operation fails.

Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.name: sendMessageParseMessage(msg:)
Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.abstract: sendMessageParseMessage asynchronously sends a given message and returns the response message object. This function may throw an error if the message is invalid, the send operation fails, or the response message is invalid.

Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.name: packMessage(msg:)
Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.abstract: packMessage asynchronously packs a given message object into a string representation. This function may throw an error if the message object is invalid.

Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.name: unpackMessage(msg:)
Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.abstract: unpackMessage asynchronously unpacks a given string representation of a message into a message object. This function may throw an error if the string is not a valid message representation.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.name: createRandomMnemonics()
Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: createRandomMnemonics creates a random set of mnemonic phrases that can be used as a seed for generating a private key.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.name: createSeed(mnemonics:passphrase:)
Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: createSeed takes in a set of mnemonics and a passphrase, and returns a seed object used to generate a private key.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: createRandomSeed creates a random seed and a corresponding set of mnemonic phrases.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.name: createKeyPair(seed:curve:)
Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: createKeyPair creates a key pair (a private and public key) using a given seed and key curve.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.name: createKeyPair(seed:privateKey:)
Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: createKeyPair creates a key pair using a given seed and a specified private key. This function may throw an error if the private key is invalid.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.name: compressedPublicKey(publicKey:)
Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: compressedPublicKey compresses a given public key into a shorter, more efficient form.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.name: uncompressedPublicKey(compressedData:)
Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: compressedPublicKey decompresses a given compressed public key into its original form.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.name: signMessage(privateKey:message:)
Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: signMessage signs a message using a given private key, returning the signature.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.name: signMessage(privateKey:message:)
Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: signMessage signs a message using a given private key, returning the signature. This function may throw an error if the message is invalid.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.name: verifySignature(publicKey:challenge:signature:)
Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: verifySignature verifies the authenticity of a signature using the corresponding public key, challenge, and signature. This function returns a boolean value indicating whether the signature is valid or not.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.name: getPrivateJWKJson(id:keyPair:)
Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: getPrivateJWKJson converts a private key pair into a JSON Web Key (JWK) format with a given ID. This function may throw an error if the key pair is invalid.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.name: getPublicJWKJson(id:keyPair:)
Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: getPublicJWKJson converts a public key pair into a JSON Web Key (JWK) format with a given ID. This function may throw an error if the key pair is invalid.

Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.name: VerificationMethod
Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.abstract: Represents a Verification Method, which is a public key or other evidence used to authenticate the identity of a Decentralized Identifier (DID) or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/Service.html.name: Service
Structs/DIDDocument/Service.html.abstract: Represents a Service, which is a capability or endpoint offered by a Decentralized Identifier (DID) or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/AlsoKnownAs.html.name: AlsoKnownAs
Structs/DIDDocument/AlsoKnownAs.html.abstract: Represents a “also known as” property, which is a list of alternative names or identifiers for a Decentralized Identifier (DID) or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/Controller.html.name: Controller
Structs/DIDDocument/Controller.html.abstract: Represents a “controller” property, which is a list of Decentralized Identifiers (DIDs) that control the associated DID or subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethods..name: VerificationMethods
Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethods..abstract: Represents a “verification methods” property, which is a list of Verification Methods associated with a Decentralized Identifier (DID) or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/Services.html.name: Services
Structs/DIDDocument/Services.html.abstract: Represents a “services” property, which is a list of Services associated with a Decentralized Identifier (DID) or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/Authentication.html.name: Authentication
Structs/DIDDocument/Authentication.html.abstract: Represents an “authentication” property, which is a list of URIs and Verification Methods that can be used to authenticate the associated DID or subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/AssertionMethod.html.name: AssertionMethod
Structs/DIDDocument/AssertionMethod.html.abstract: Represents an “assertion method” property, which is a list of URIs and Verification Methods that can be used to assert the authenticity of a message or credential associated with a DID or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/KeyAgreement.html.name: KeyAgreement
Structs/DIDDocument/KeyAgreement.html.abstract: Represents a “key agreement” property, which is a list of URIs and Verification Methods that can be used to establish a secure communication channel with a DID or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/CapabilityInvocation.name: CapabilityInvocation
Structs/DIDDocument/CapabilityInvocation.abstract: Represents a “capability invocation” property, which is a list of URIs and Verification Methods that can be used to invoke a specific capability or service provided by a DID or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/CapabilityDelegation.name: CapabilityDelegation
Structs/DIDDocument/CapabilityDelegation.abstract: Represents a “capability delegation” property, which is a list of URIs and Verification Methods that can be used to delegate a specific capability or service provided by a DID or other subject or object to another subject or object.

Structs/DID.html.name: DID
Structs/DID.html.abstract: A DID is a unique and persistent identifier for a subject or object, such as a person, organization, or device. It is created and managed using a specific DID method, and consists of a schema, method, and method ID. The schema indicates the type of DID (e.g. “did”), the method indicates the specific protocol or process used to resolve and manage the DID (e.g. “prism”), and the method ID is a unique identifier within the DID method.

Structs/DIDPair.html.name: DIDPair
Structs/DIDPair.html.abstract: Represents a pair of DIDs, typically used for secure communication or delegation of capabilities or services.

Structs/JWTCredentialPayload.html.name: JWTCredentialPayload
Structs/JWTCredentialPayload.html.abstract: A struct representing a JWT credential payload.

Structs/KeyPair.html.name: KeyPair
Structs/KeyPair.html.abstract: Represents a pair of private and public keys for a specific key curve.

Structs/Message.html.name: Message
Structs/Message.html.abstract: The Message struct represents a DIDComm message, which is used for secure, decentralized communication in the Atala PRISM architecture. A Message object includes information about the sender, recipient, message body, and other metadata. Message objects are typically exchanged between DID controllers using the Mercury building block.

Structs/AttachmentHeader.html.name: AttachmentHeader

Structs/AttachmentJws.html.name: AttachmentJws

Structs/AttachmentJsonData.html.abstract: The AttachmentJsonData struct represents a DIDComm attachment containing JSON data.

Structs/AttachmentDescriptor.html.name: AttachmentDescriptor
Structs/AttachmentDescriptor.html.abstract: The AttachmentDescriptor struct represents metadata for a DIDComm attachment.

Protocols/Pluto.html.name: Pluto
Protocols/Pluto.html.abstract: The Pluto protocol defines the set of storage operations that are used in the Atala PRISM architecture. It provides an interface for storage operations in a portable, storage-agnostic manner, allowing data to be stored and retrieved using a variety of storage solutions.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: parseDID(str:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: parseDID parses a string representation of a Decentralized Identifier (DID) into a DID object. This function may throw an error if the string is not a valid DID.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: createPrismDID(masterPublicKey:services:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: createPrismDID creates a DID for a prism (a device or server that acts as a DID owner and controller) using a given master public key and list of services. This function may throw an error if the master public key or services are invalid.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: createPeerDID(keyAgreementKeyPair:authenticationKeyPair:services:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: createPeerDID creates a DID for a peer (a device or server that acts as a DID subject) using given key agreement and authentication key pairs and a list of services. This function may throw an error if the key pairs or services are invalid.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: resolveDID(did:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: resolveDID asynchronously resolves a DID to its corresponding DID Document. This function may throw an error if the DID is invalid or the document cannot be retrieved.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: verifySignature(did:challenge:signature:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: verifySignature asynchronously verifies the authenticity of a signature using the corresponding DID, challenge, and signature data. This function returns a boolean value indicating whether the signature is valid or not. This function may throw an error if the DID or signature data are invalid.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: verifySignature(document:challenge:signature:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: verifySignature verifies the authenticity of a signature using the corresponding DID Document, challenge, and signature data. This function returns a boolean value indicating whether the signature is valid or not. This function may throw an error if the DID Document or signature data are invalid.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: getEcnumbasis(did:keyPair:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: getEcnumbasis generates a unique ECNUM basis string for a given DID and key pair. This function may throw an error if the DID or key pair are invalid.

Protocols/Castor.html.name: Castor
Protocols/Castor.html.abstract: The Castor protocol defines the set of decentralized identifier (DID) operations that are used in the Atala PRISM architecture. It provides a way for users to create, manage, and control their DIDs and associated cryptographic keys.

Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.name: createRandomMnemonics()
Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.abstract: createRandomMnemonics creates a random set of mnemonic phrases that can be used as a seed for generating a private key.

Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.name: createSeed(mnemonics:passphrase:)
Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.abstract: createSeed takes in a set of mnemonics and a passphrase, and returns a seed object used to generate a private key.

Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.name: createRandomSeed()
Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.abstract: createRandomSeed creates a random seed and a corresponding set of mnemonic phrases.

Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.name: createKeyPair(seed:curve:)
Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.abstract: createKeyPair creates a key pair (a private and public key) using a given seed and key curve.

Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.name: createKeyPair(seed:privateKey:)
Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.abstract: createKeyPair creates a key pair using a given seed and a specified private key. This function may throw an error if the private key is invalid.

Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.name: compressedPublicKey(publicKey:)
Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.abstract: compressedPublicKey compresses a given public key into a shorter, more efficient form.

Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.name: uncompressedPublicKey(compressedData:)
Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.abstract: compressedPublicKey decompresses a given compressed public key into its original form.

Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.name: signMessage(privateKey:message:)
Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.abstract: signMessage signs a message using a given private key, returning the signature.

Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.name: signMessage(privateKey:message:)
Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.abstract: signMessage signs a message using a given private key, returning the signature. This function may throw an error if the message is invalid.

Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.name: verifySignature(publicKey:challenge:signature:)
Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.abstract: verifySignature verifies the authenticity of a signature using the corresponding public key, challenge, and signature. This function returns a boolean value indicating whether the signature is valid or not.

Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.name: getPrivateJWKJson(id:keyPair:)
Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.abstract: getPrivateJWKJson converts a private key pair into a JSON Web Key (JWK) format with a given ID. This function may throw an error if the key pair is invalid.

Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.name: getPublicJWKJson(id:keyPair:)
Protocols/Apollo.html#/s:6Domain6ApolloP.abstract: getPublicJWKJson converts a public key pair into a JSON Web Key (JWK) format with a given ID. This function may throw an error if the key pair is invalid.
